result.execSummary:
The defendant Keenen Michael Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
All mandatory court costs, fees and assessments  to be paid including the DNA and DV surcharges during the period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Any cash bail on deposit may apply if applicable.
Court waives all nonmandatory costs due to inability to pay.
-Restitution set at $0.00

Court advised defendant of appellant rights.
Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Batterers Intervention Program.
Mental health evaluation and take presribed medication.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keenen Michael Walker

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keenen Michael Walker in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for Plea/Sentencing hearing.

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant. Additional statement by A.W.

As to Count 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 6 days served. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 9 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Restitution set at $0.00.
- Batterers Intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation and take prescribed medication.
- No violent contact with A.W.
- 25 hours of community service.
- Provide DNA Sample.
- All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid including the DNA and DV surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
- Any cash bail on deposit may apply if applicable.
- Obtain/ Maintain employment.
- Defendant IS ELIGIBLE for expungement.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights, filed.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, filed.

Defendant Keenen Michael Walker in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defense counsel requests an adjourned plea and sentencing hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Keenen Michael Walker in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Keenen Michael Walker in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defense counsel advises the court a hearing is not needed today. Defense requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Keenen Michael Walker in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense requests the no contact order be modified. State objects. Court takes the request to modify the no contact order under advisement.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Keenen Michael Walker in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Mario Fiumefreddo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel has an offer and requests an additional scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Keenen Michael Walker in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Mario Fiumefreddo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail/bond hearing held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. The victim requests the no contact order be modified. State objects. Defense takes no position. Court DENIES the request at this time. Defense requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with AAS, JJ, FF, and JL
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Keenen Michael Walker in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Keenen Michael Walker in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keenen Michael Walker appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
